alert.note: Alert for McHenry; McLean; Mercer; Ward (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 10:18PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN WARD, MCLEAN, SOUTHWESTERN MCHENRY AND NORTHEASTERN MERCER COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 PM CDT... At 1016 PM CDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Minot to near Max to near Hazen Bay Recreation Area. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Surrey around 1020 PM CDT. Benedict and Fort Stevenson State Park around 1025 PM CDT. Granville around 1035 PM CDT. Coleharbor around 1040 PM CDT. Underwood, Denbigh and Butte around 1045 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Logan, White Shield, Strawberry Lake, Bergen, Falkirk, Norwich, Voltaire, Ruso, Dakota Waters Recreation Area and Emmet. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If on or near eastern portions of Lake Sakakawea get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
